detect_number(image_0, 0).
detect_number(image_1, 1).
detect_number(image_2, 2).
detect_number(image_3, 3).

detect_number(image_6, 6).

detect_number(image_9, 9).
detect_operator(image_plus, +).
detect_operator(image_minus, -).
detect_operator(image_multiply, *).
detect_operator(image_divide, /).
detect_all([N], [N2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2).
detect_all([N,O|T], [N2,O2|T2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2), 
 detect_operator(O, O2), 
 detect_all(T, T2).
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 ground(Y), 
 abs(X - Y) < 0.0001.
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 var(Y), 
 Y is float(X).
expression(Images, Result) :- 
 detect_all(Images, Symbols), 
 parse(Symbols, Result).
parse([N], R) :- 
 almost_equal(N, R).
parse([N1, '+', N2 | T], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 + N2, R1),
    parse([R1 | T], R).
parse([N1, '-', N2 | T], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 - N2, R1),
    parse([R1 | T], R).
parse([N1, '*', N2 | T], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 * N2, R1),
    parse([R1 | T], R).
parse([N1, '/', N2 | T], R) :-
    almost_equal(N1 / N2, R1),
    parse([R1 | T], R).
query(expression([image_2, image_divide, image_3, image_plus, image_3, image_minus, image_2, image_multiply, image_7], X)).
final_report: The generated code modifies the parsing logic for arithmetic operations, which leads to incorrect results. Unlike the original code, which handles operator precedence correctly by recursively parsing expressions, the generated code processes operations in a left-associative manner without considering precedence. This results in the wrong calculation for the given query. The generated code is syntactically valid but semantically incorrect as it does not produce the expected result.
